summary.p: This bundle (35-3053 palm leaf manuscript) contains the Varāhapurāṇa of Vedavyāsa in Telugu script. The text is incomplete and it contains adhyāya-s 1 to 100.

The Varāhapurāṇa is a genre of literature in Hinduism. The Purāṇa-s are classified as Viṣṇu, Brahmā, or Śiva according to the degree of quality — sattva, rajas and tamas — which they possess in prominence. Judged by this standard the Varāhapurāṇa belongs to Vaiṣṇavism. The majority of the verses relate to Vaiṣṇava rituals, and Vaiṣṇava stotra-s. The Purāṇa eulogizes the ten incarnations of Viṣṇu and proclaims that a devotee attains identity with the lord by reciting and listening to his praise.

Preface of Viṣṇu, addressed to his specific forms, under particular names such as Matsya, Varāha and Kūrma. To one of the queries of Bhūdevī about the instances when Lord Viṣṇu assumed various forms as extreme situations were faced by the Universe, especially when injustice and evil forces reached a point of no return, the reply from Lord Varāha was quite positive.

A number of chapters describe the initiation of devotees to Viṣṇu. The Purāṇa prescribes initiation not only for the Brāhmaṇās but also for the Kṣatriyās, Vaiśyās and Śūdrās. The Purāṇa records a number of religious vows which a devotee should observe at certain holy places for attaining his desire. Mention may be made in this context of Dvādaśīvrata observed on the twelfth day of the bright fortnight of each month of the year.

The Varāhapurāṇa includes mythology, particularly of the Varāha incarnation of Viṣṇu rescuing the earth at the time of a great flood. The text also includes mythology of goddesses and Śiva, and a discussion of Karma and Dharma called Dharmasamhitā.

msItem.author: Vedavyāsa
msItem.incipit: namastasmai varāhāya līlayoddharate mahīm| khuramadhyagato yasya meruḥ kharakharāyate| daṃṣṭrāgreṇādbhutā gaurudadhiparivṛtā parvataiḥ nimnagābhiḥ| sākaṃ mṛtpiṇḍavatprāgbṛhaduruvapuṣā'nantarūpeṇa yena| so'yaṃ kaṃsāsurārirmuranarakadaśāsyāntakṛsarvasaṃsthaḥ| kṛṣṇo viṣṇuḥ sureśe nudatu mama ripūnādidevo varāhaḥ| sūta uvāca| yasmin kāle kṣitiḥ pūrve varāhavapuṣā tu sā| uddhṛtā vibhunā śaktyā papraccha parameśvaram| dharaṇyuvāca| kalpe kalpe bhavānevaṃ māṃ samuddharati prabho| na cāhaṃ veda te mūrtimādisarge ca keśava| vedeṣu caiva naṣṭeṣu matsyo bhūtvā rasātalāt| praviśya tānathotkṛṣya brahmaṇe dattavānasi|
msItem.explicit: brahmahā pitṛhā goghnaḥ surāpo gurutalpagaḥ| vimuktāḥ sarvapāpaistu gantāro viṣṇumandire| vimuktaḥ sarvapāpaistu viṣṇulokaṃ sa gacchati| yo'śvamedhena yajate samāptavaradakṣiṇaḥ| jaladhenuṃ ca yo dadyātsamametannarādhipa| jalāhārastvekadinaṃ tiṣṭhecca jaladhenudaḥ| grāhako'pi trirātraṃ ve tiṣṭhedevaṃ na saṃśayaḥ| yatra kṣīrapayā nadyo madhupāyasakarmāḥ| yatra cāpsarasāṃ gītaṃ tatra yānti jalapradāḥ| dātā ca dāpakaścaiva pratigrāhī ca yo dvijaḥ| yaścaiva śṛṇuyādbhaktyā nairantaryeṇa mānavaḥ| śṛtvā ca pūjayecchāstraṃ yathā viṣṇuṃ sanātanam| gandhaiḥ puṣpaistathā vastraiḥ brāhmaṇānāṃ ca tarpaṇaiḥ| avajñāya śrutenetthamapūjya ca dharādhare| mūrkho bhavati janmāni sapta mūkaśca mānavaḥ| natvā sa pūjayedyastu śāstraṃ vārāhasaṃjñitam|
msItem.finalRubric: iti śrīvarāhapurāṇe śvetavinītāśvopākhyāne jaladhenuvidhirnāma śatatamodhyāyaḥ| varāhākhyam saṃhiteyaṃ samāptam|
